answers.author: Paul Scher
answers.text:
Though the links below do not directly pertain to the methods of change management for multiple initiatives that you requested, it is to be hoped that the following articles and case study will serve at least as relevant starting points for further research. The first linked article is entitled “Comparison of Change Theories” (http://bit.ly/j2C63g) and it comes to us from the International Journal of Scholarly Academic Intellectual Diversity. Our second link is a state-level view of change management from the National Association of State Chief Information Officers entitled “Transforming Government through Change Management” (http://www.nascio.org/publications/.) Also attached is an article entitled, “Analysis of Public Management Change Processes: The Case of Local Government Accounting Reforms in Germany” (http://bit.ly/lZY4c6). Our final link comes from local governments in the United Kingdom and provides us with a series of cases studies and good practice (http://bit.ly/leftBH).

author: Dorian Kachur
text:
I am interested in learning how organizations manage the co-ordinated roll-out of multiple corporate initiatives that affect either all or major groups of employees so that there is time to train, familiarize and adapt between initiatives.  
These initiatives might include new technologies, security processes, software, corporate processes, budgeting, safety initiatives, employee training initiatives....
Thank you.
title: Portfolio Management
